title: What is the difference between the rate constant and the rate of reaction? - Quora

response.answer_text: The rate of a reaction is a number given in mol/sec, whereas the rate constant is a value that must be determined experimentally from a rate of a reaction. For example, one can write for a given reaction A + B => AB (only after experimental evidence shows the order of each of the reactants!)  if it is known that A is a second-order reactant and B is a first-order reactant. The quantity “rate” is the rate of reaction and “k” is the constant that allows us to calculate the rate of reaction for any given concentration of reactants.
